overview:
Scott Stanford Co-Heads Goldman Sachs’ Global Internet Investment Banking business. He has been with Goldman Sachs for over twelve years, in the Internet sector for fifteen years and active in Technology for twenty-nine years where he has acted in the capacity of advisor, operator and investor.

Scott advises clients on equity and debt financings, mergers and acquisitions as well as makes principal investments for the Firm. He is a founding member of the Firm’s Internet Investment Committee and helped lead the Firm’s investments including Facebook, Uber, Square, Linkedin, Palantir among others. He has client coverage responsibility for companies including Facebook, Google, Yahoo, Groupon, Zillow, Airbnb and many other established and emerging Internet companies.

Prior to rejoining Goldman in 2004, Scott was a Section 16 officer of LookSmart, helping build the company from a start-up in 1999 to a publicly traded NASDAQ company. During his 5 years with LookSmart he held several technical, product, financial and strategic management positions including heading eCommerce, overseeing Product and Development, running Strategy and Corporate Development and running Business Development. He spent his business school summer as an Associate at General Atlantic Partners. Prior to business school, Scott was a Financial Analyst with Goldman Sachs’ Fixed Income Group from 1993 to 1996 in New York City. During this time he developed applications and structured and marketed Interest Rate Swaps and Options for the Firm’s municipal clients.

Scott has a B.A. with Honors and M.B.A. from Harvard University and lives with his wife and two children in San Francisco.
